intro: [WRONG START] Illcebrum alsinefolium, commonly known as the creeping spleenworts, is a member of the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. It is a low-growing perennial plant that typically thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
